TopicTitle: KSC ground and terrain color matching?

Articles.Content:
So I remember that on my old computer the colors of the ground for the Kerbal Space Center and the actual terrain were the same, but now, they're different colors the terrain is much darker than the actual space center grass and I play with the settings but nothing changes. Anybody know how to make them the same?

In this image they're the same:

In mine they aren't:

Edited March 13, 2014 by Sippyfrog

Mine is the same way, however mine is like that due to a settings.cfg file I downloaded that increased the games performance.

Did you do the same thing and forget?

A solution you could try is to delete your settings file. The game will generate a new one when you start it up with default settings. This might make your problem go away.

Mine is the same way, however mine is like that due to a settings.cfg file I downloaded that increased the games performance.

Did you do the same thing and forget?

A solution you could try is to delete your settings file. The game will generate a new one when you start it up with default settings. This might make your problem go away.

Solved it it was the terrain shaders setting that does it, with it enabled it matches the two but when off they'll look different. I didn't discover it because it needed a restart to change the settings
